description: From Middle English promulgaten, from Latin prōmulgātus, past participle of prōmulgō (“I make known, publish”), either from provulgō (“I make known, publish”), from pro (“forth”) + vulgō (“I publish”), or from mulgeō (“I bring forth”, literally “I milk”). Compare promulge.

verbs.description: promulgate (third-person singular simple present promulgates, present participle promulgating, simple past and past participle promulgated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put into effect as a regulation.
examples: Synonyms: carry out, execute, implement, put into effect
